alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Kearney; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 1:29PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Phelps, northwestern Kearney, southwestern Buffalo, southeastern Gosper, southeastern Dawson, northeastern Furnas and northwestern Harlan Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 128 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Edison, or 18 miles west of Holdrege, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bertrand and Loomis around 140 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Overton, Elm Creek, Amherst and Miller. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 247 and 282. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Kearney; Phelps
